title: Combating terrorism: NATO's role

Fighting terrorism is one of the main issues on NATO's agenda and has been since the adoption of the 1999 Strategic Concept and the terrorist attacks against the United States on 11 September 2001. This DVD illustrates some aspects of how NATO is combating terrorism on political and military fronts, as well as through its cooperation with Partners.

A DVD presented by NATO Public Diplomacy Division
Producer: NATO - 2004

Disclaimer;
The texts and information on this DVD have been compiled from different sources. They only illustrate some aspects of NATO's role in the fight against terrorism and should not be considered as a complete overview on the subject. While they reflect as closely as possible the consensus among the member countries, which is the basis for all Allied decisions, they are not formally agreed NATO documents. They may therefore not necessarily represent the official opinions or positions of individual member governments on the issues discussed.

This DVD is distributed free of charge by NATO's Public Diplomacy Division and is not available through commercial outlets.
